wordpressPost.title: “Why the hell would anyone want to kill themselves?”
wordpressPost.content:
“Why the hell would anyone want to kill themselves?”

“Why the hell would anyone want to kill themselves when they have all the money they need, a good car and, a girlfriend?” This is what my brother asked me when I told him about a family member who was seriously struggling with depression.

I told him that money didn’t make a person happy and I reminded him of the examples of movie stars that had it all and then their lives went to hell.

Those of us who don’t have money make the mistake of thinking that if we did have money, that all of our problems would go away.

Well, as I get older I see that money can help with problems especially money problems but, it won’t cure depression.  In fact, I think money could make the disease even worse. Just think if someone were depressed and they had all the money to throw at the problem and, it didn’t work.  Where would the hope be?

I don’t have depression (thank God) but I know depression because, I watched many of my dear family members struggle from it and then lose the battle with it.  Depression is not pretty, it’s delusional and it’s something that if you haven’t lived with it, you can never fully respect it’s devastation.

To ask someone “why are you depressed” or say to them “try and be happy” or, “get over it” is like saying to a dying cancer patient, “just get your out of bed and will yourself better.”

Depression doesn’t care about the person that it occupies.  It puts that person in a deep dark hole that most can’t or don’t climb out of.

Sure, there may be medication and talk therapy but, I don’t see a lot of people recovering completely.  I think once it grabs on to your soul, you try and try as you may, you can’t ever fully rid yourself of it’s disgusting grip.

I know people can live with depression just like diabetes, aids, and other diseases however, these are diseases of the body that allow one to move about the day but having a disease of the mind and one of the spirit, stays with you twenty-four seven.  It never lets go and, never allows one to live with intention.

Two weeks ago, my mother finally found peace by overdosing on Methadone.  I was in awe when I saw her sweet little body on her couch.  I could see that she was no longer in spiritual pain and she was set free from the darkness that lived in her soul.  I was happy for her and I knew this day would come.  I was very sad but something in me found a comfort that I can’t explain.

Genetically, the odds are against me.  Genetically they are against my children and, honestly the cycle has continued to where I can’t say now however, when someone asks why a depressed person just can’t be happy, I respond back with “yeah and why can’t a brain tumor just magically disappear with only a smile.”
